The True Cost of Loyalty Programs

Most shops don't realize their loyalty program is eating 10-15% of revenue

Punch Cards

8-12%
Hidden cost of revenue
  • ‚úó "Buy 10 get 1 free" = 10% off best customers
  • ‚úó No data on who redeems or how often
  • ‚úó Cards lost, stolen, or duplicated
  • ‚úó Can't re-engage lapsed customers
  • ‚úó Rewards loyalty, doesn't grow it

Square Loyalty

$45-105
Per month + scaling costs
  • ‚ö† Card-linked = auto-enrolls every card
  • ‚ö† You pay for one-time visitors too
  • ‚ö† Costs rise as more customers transact
  • ‚ö† Still need separate discount budget
  • ‚ö† No network benefit - just your shop
Tiered Pricing (Per Location)
0-500 visits$45/mo
501-1,500 visits$75/mo
1,501-10,000 visits$105/mo

joe Universal Rewards

~1%
Effective cost. Transparent.
  • ‚úì We hold 6%, pay back for discounts & promos
  • ‚úì Full customer data: visits, spend, preferences
  • ‚úì Automated win-back campaigns
  • ‚úì Network effect: acquire from other joe shops
  • ‚úì 41x proven ROI from partner data

üí° The Square "Card-Linked" Trap

Square automatically counts every unique payment card as a "loyalty visit" - even one-time customers who never return. As your business grows, you're pushed into higher pricing tiers whether you want it or not.

‚ö†Ô∏è Check Your Square Reports

Go to Square Dashboard ‚Üí Reports ‚Üí Discounts. Most coffee shops are shocked to see 10-15% of their revenue going to discounts and giveaways. Combined with processing fees and Square Loyalty subscription, you're looking at a 15-18% effective rate. With joe, your Universal Rewards has an effective cost of approximately 1% - we hold 6% for loyalty transactions and use it to fund all discounts, giveaways, and loyalty rewards.
